programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Casey tries to restrain Rene's spending habits, while Darrell and Brandon rely on their intuition to beat the competition. Elsewhere, Ivy plans to spy on Jarrod and Brandi's buying strategy.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An autograph of baseball legend Honus Wagner lands in the shop, and Rick checks out a first edition of Nabokov's controversial novel, Lolita.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: A 1967 Shelby GT350 speeds into the shop, and Chumlee toys with the idea of buying one of the first video game consoles, a Magnavox Odyssey 200

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer brings in an Olympic torch used in the relay for the 2002 Winter Games, an event held in Salt Lake City, Utah.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: Les attends a business meeting, and as soon as he has gone Ashley tries to undermine Seth. A vicious standoff results after the vendors fail to agree a price of some jewellery. Documentary series following the daily running of a pawn shop.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.sub-title: Ice Chip Off the Old Block
programme.desc: Jimmie values an unusual concession stand and what is supposedly a lock of Bigfoot's hair.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie comes across a cheque signed by Judy Garland, a 1930s baseball programme and a rifle that could be more than 100 years old.

programme.title: Stan Lee's Superhumans
programme.desc: The Spider-Man co-creator locates an impressive knife-thrower, an arm wrestler of prodigious talent, and a very unusual roller skater.

programme.title: Unusual Suspects
programme.desc: Las Vegas police struggled for 18 years before bringing the case of the sexual assault and murder of 52-year-old bartender Martha Doney to a surprising conclusion.

programme.title: Strippers: Cars for Cash
programme.desc: The teams find a Triumph Herald and Ford Anglia as they search for 1960s cars to strip to a shell and compete to make the most profit in scrap value.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Johnnie finds some of Dwight Eisenhower's writing, and Yankee tries to restore an old go-kart.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Country singer Tracy Lawrence brings a guitar from the 1920s to the shop, and Jimmie checks out a mechanical bull and a pot for cooking crayfish.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Tammie bets Jimmie that she can make a profit from a bar on wheels, and the team checks out a 1930s horse racing game.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys go on a road trip, and are offered the chance to buy a 1920s Chevrolet and a note signed by Francis Scott Key, writer of the US national anthem.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie visits a famous hotel to examine some furniture, and the guys value a restored 1929 Ford fire engine.

programme.title: Cajun Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Jimmie revisits his childhood with a 1950s Space Commander ride, and when his staff are late, sets them a challenge.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank have an unsuccessful search through a pile of junk, but the discovery of a vintage guitar marks a change in their fortunes.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike and Frank meet a racing driver and inspect his collection of motoring memorabilia, and also gamble on buying some vintage pilots equipment.

programme.title: American Pickers
programme.desc: Mike is tempted by a retro smoking toy he finds in New Hampshire and needs Frank's bargaining skills to ensure a good price.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The Gold family and its employees are ready to haggle as members of the public continue to bring in their unique items in the hope of raising some cash.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A customer wants to sell a coat allegedly made of rare monkey fur. Seth is tempted to make a purchase that could prove beneficial to the finances of the business.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: The toss of a coin determines the value of a gold chain Les believes is out of fashion. A customer is upset when Seth prevents her from using the staff toilets.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A woman rejects custom-made earrings, as she thought the term diamond cut meant they were diamonds. Seth puts his faith into younger sellers, believing they can outperform Les.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: An employee accidentally cracks the screen of a plasma-screen television. A customer becomes irate when the pneumatic hammer he is trying to sell does not work.

programme.title: Hardcore Pawn
programme.desc: A man sells Seth some Detroit Red Wings memorabilia, but Les feels that the money offered was too much and some of the items he purchased are just for him and not for resale.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Huntington Beach for a night-time auction. Mary and Ivy get into a heated bidding war, while Dave looks to score big or go home.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Rene brings his dad to the auction, leading to comical developments, while Ivy goes in big despite carrying an injury.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.sub-title: The Fat Lady Is Warming Up
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi look to coast through the auctions, but end up having a marathon. Darrell faces the auction without Brandon to back him up.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers hit the Palm Springs desert hoping for some hot profits. Mary sticks to a tight budget while Darrell is willing to spend big.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: The buyers head to Dan and Laura's house for a charity white elephant gift exchange. It might well be for charity, but will the warriors leave their competitive sides at the door?.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: An 1800s one-horse-open sleigh rides in, but it remains to be seen whether Rick and Corey make an offer on the potentially lucrative item.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: Members of the team get their hands on a rare photograph of Albert Einstein and a collection of top-secret documents from the Pentagon.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys interview applicants for the night shift position and examine a valuable first edition of David Thoreau's classic book Walden.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team values a 1920s doll of aviator Charles Lindbergh and a harmonica belonging to Aerosmith singer Steven Tyler.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The team tries to make a deal on a guitar signed by Crosby, Stills & Nash, and also examines a pair of bomb fins from the Second World War.

programme.title: Pawn Stars
programme.desc: The guys value an air mail letter delivered by aviation pioneer Charles Lindbergh on the Spirit of St Louis, as well as a collection of mini bikes and a baseball bat from the 1900s.

programme.title: Caligula: 1,400 Days of Terror
programme.desc: Dramatised documentary examining Roman emperor Caligula, whose rule lasted only 1,400 days, revealing the truth behind the infamous tales of brutality, excess and depravity.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Darrell plays pranks on his rivals to distract them from the best lockers, Rene and Casey have a disagreement, and Ivy is excited by the items on offer.

programme.title: Storage Wars
programme.desc: Jarrod and Brandi test a bidding strategy, while Darrell and Brandon are under pressure to find merchandise for their website.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by presenter Richard Madeley and actor Sanjeev Bhaskar, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes naturalist Kate Humble and comedian Miles Jupp. Host Rob Brydon oversees the comedy panel show as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves.

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.sub-title: Have I Got a Bit More Old News for You
programme.desc: Actor Danny Dyer takes over the reins for extended edition of the satirical quiz from November 2018, with comedian Sara Pascoe and tennis coach Judy Murray joining team captains Ian Hislop and Paul Merton to poke fun at the stories making the headlines.

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Extended edition. Janet Street-Porter, Sandi Toksvig and Johnny Vegas join regular panellist Alan Davies on the comedy quiz. Host Stephen Fry asks a range of fiendish questions on the topic of kinky, with points being awarded for interesting answers as well as correct ones.

programme.title: Sliced
programme.desc: Joshua and Ricky get invited to a sex party - on a council estate - and Naomi is rightly furious when she gets sent a rather saucy unsolicited gift in the post.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by comedian Rhod Gilbert and actress Sally Phillips, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes TV presenters Des O'Connor and Tess Daly. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Glenn Moore join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: Les from Liverpool is delighted with Rebecca and Elo's choices, and he decides whether he will drive off and burning rubber in an Aston Martin or a supercharged classic Ferrari.

programme.title: Modern Wheels or Classic Steals
programme.desc: George wants to upgrade his ageing Range Rover with something more stylish and powerful, but is caught between buying a sporty number for himself or pleasing his wife.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Elysian Park in Los Angeles is turned into an obstacle-littered course for the day as 70 teams of adrenaline junkies put their gravity-powered contraptions to the test.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie Hall visits Fort Worth, Texas, where he takes on a monster pancake challenge, a painful rodeo test, and local delicacy calves' testes in the world's largest Honky Tonk venue.

programme.title: Eddie Eats America
programme.desc: Eddie hits San Antonio to sample the finest Tex-Mex food and a gigantic chicken fried steak - with no chicken. He also tests whether he has the moves for TV show Ninja Warrior.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: The guys go west on a sun-soaked journey for the best nuggets the Golden State has to offer.

programme.title: American Pickers: Best Of
programme.desc: Mike and Frank come across the best comic book, superhero and sci-fi memorabilia in the history of the show, including a rare Spider-Man comic book and the original Batmobile.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Elysian Park in Los Angeles is turned into an obstacle-littered course for the day as 70 teams of adrenaline junkies put their gravity-powered contraptions to the test.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds return from their honeymoon to a big welcome from both their families. However, Smithy seems disconcerted by his pal's return and Nessa makes a confession that spoils the happy occasion. Comedy, starring Mathew Horne, James Corden and Joanna Page.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy goes missing following Nessa's shocking revelation, and the boys try to track him down to persuade him to accept his responsibilities. Meanwhile, Stacey is forced to contemplate the consequences of transforming her long-distance relationship with Gavin into a functioning marriage.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Smithy accompanies Nessa to the hospital for her first ultrasound scan, and the pair catch a glimpse of their baby. Stacey becomes unusually excited at the prospect of a weekend visit to her family home after she struggles to adjust to her role as an 'Essex wife' - which proves to lack some of the glamour she had expected.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: After a day spent house-hunting, the newlyweds take up an invitation from Nessa and Smithy to relax with a trip to the bowling alley. However, when tensions between Gavin and Stacey reach a head at the end of the night, their two friends begin to regret making the offer.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Hapless uncle Bryn organises a special treat for Gwen's birthday. However, his supposedly covert actions do not go as unnoticed as he would like, and an unexpected guest arrives. Meanwhile, Stacey tries to summon the courage to tell Gavin of her big decision.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: The newlyweds begin leading separate lives back in their home towns. In Essex, Smithy makes efforts to remind Gavin of the excitement of his bachelor years with a traditional boys' night out. Meanwhile in Barry, Stacey tries to distract herself with a trip to the bingo.

programme.title: Gavin & Stacey
programme.desc: Nessa goes into labour a month early in Barry, and the newlyweds must forget their differences to track down Smithy in time for the birth of his child. Meanwhile, Stacey returns to Essex to salvage her marriage.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: The competing teams' motorless vehicles use gravity as their only form of propulsion in the Belgian capital of Brussels.

programme.title: Red Bull Soapbox Race
programme.desc: Highlights of the offbeat event, where teams create vehicles without engines and race downhill.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. This week the couple become addicted to a TV box set, causing them to cancel dinner with Toby and Anna at the last moment. But when they lie about the reason, it only succeeds in opening up a huge can of worms. Domestic comedy, with Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are trying to make the family healthier, so they are not too happy about the school lollipop man handing out sweets to the kids. Domestic comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee Mack and Sally Bretton star in the domestic comedy which sees the couple appear to go from one disaster to the next, while coping with their three kids, Lucy's disapproving parents, Lee's feckless dad Frank and their world-weary friends Toby and Anna. In this final episode, Lucy begins to consider having a breast augmentation, encouraged by Anna, wondering whether it will help her regain some of the femininity she felt in her youth. With Abigail Cruttenden and Hugh Dennis.

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Lee and Lucy are strong-armed into organising a Christmas variety show to raise money for their children's school. However, things prove to be far from plain sailing, as quality acts are worryingly thin on the ground and an animal impersonator as the only confirmed performer. Who can the duo turn to - surely not Toby and uptight wife Anna? With raw egg-juggling and some knife throwing for good measure, what could possibly go wrong - especially in a live instalment of this award-winning sitcom from 2018? Lee Mack, Sally Bretton, Hugh Dennis and Abigail Cruttenden star.

programme.title: Would I Lie to You?
programme.desc: Team captain David Mitchell is joined by comedian Rhod Gilbert and actress Sally Phillips, while his counterpart Lee Mack welcomes TV presenters Des O'Connor and Tess Daly. Host Rob Brydon oversees proceedings as the contestants try to hoodwink their opponents with absurd facts and plausible lies about themselves on the comedy panel show.

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: James Acaster, Angela Barnes, Kerry Godliman, Nish Kumar and Glenn Moore join host Dara O Briain and regular participant Hugh Dennis for the topical comedy show, looking back at the week's events through the medium of fast-thinking and improvisation.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Meeting the Welsh Highland Railway's oldest volunteer fireman, 80-year-old Cedric Lodge, who has worked on the railways for 60 years. In Devon, there is a look at the Autotrain.

programme.title: War Factories
programme.desc: The sabotaging efforts of Peugeot in Nazi-occupied France, where the bosses and workers cooperated closely with the Resistance to hinder the use of military vehicles by the Nazis.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: An unprecedented insight into the Royals and the armed services that fight in their name, from the early 20th century to modern-day conflicts such as Afghanistan. The first episode focuses on Prince Philip and Queen Elizabeth.

programme.title: Royals on the Frontline
programme.desc: Prince Andrew discusses his stint in the Falklands and what it's really like to confront your own mortality, while Prince Edward's decision to quit his marine training is examined.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: Reflections on the final days of the Second World War and the surrender of the Axis powers, including how empires fell and the political map of the world was remade.

programme.title: WW2 Price of Empire
programme.desc: History of the conflict, examining its lasting impact on the political powers that were involved, beginning with a look at 1939 and how different countries were drawn into the war.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: A look at how corruption became rife within the SS, with the money stolen from Jews finding its way into the pockets of the camp guards rather than funding the war effort. Many of the SS also enjoyed illicit sexual relationships with female prisoners. Meanwhile, Dr Mengele embarked on a gruesome series of experiments, using children as guinea pigs in his research into genetic inheritance.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The events of 1944, when the death toll rose substantially. By this point, the Allies were aware of Auschwitz's purpose, and faced a difficult decision over what should be done about it. Plus, the story of the occupation of Hungary, revealing how Adolf Eichmann offered to spare a million Jews in return for certain services.

programme.title: Auschwitz: The Nazis and the Final Solution
programme.desc: The final episode examines the liberation of Auschwitz and other camps by the Soviet Red Army. However, freedom did not mean an end to the prisoners' suffering - many were mistreated by their liberators and thousands died for the want of medical treatment.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: An exploration of the world's most densely inhabited waters, where variations in temperature owing to the year-long cycle of the sun encourage a vast array of marine life, from seals and sharks in the winter, to lobster and salmon in the summer, dolphins in the autumn and the walking handfish in spring. Narrated by David Attenborough.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Veteran naturalist David Attenborough explores the fragile marine ecosystem of the coral reef, where all creatures, including the corals themselves, have to fight for survival. From tiny beginnings, the reef grows and develops over hundreds of years, providing support for innumerable animals - yet one storm can threaten the entire community.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: David Attenborough investigates the opportunities tides create for marine life, showing giant stingrays gliding on currents for a rest, South African sea snails surfing the waves in pursuit of a meal, crabs playing football on a beach, and bottlenose dolphins embarking on a dangerous game of catch. In the oceanic world each turn of the tide can mean life or death for its inhabitants.

programme.title: The Blue Planet
programme.desc: Exploring the wealth of marine life that inhabits the ocean's edge, dealing with the dangers of an ever-shifting environment. David Attenborough observes nesting seabirds in east Russia, Patagonian killer whales, Newfoundland caplin fish, walruses, and Brazilian green turtles - which make their annual expedition to an island in the middle of the Atlantic to lay their eggs.

programme.title: Underground Worlds
programme.desc: The underground bases built by the German army during the occupation of Jersey, and a group of more than 20 underground cities in Turkey, one of which dates back to 800BC.

programme.title: Abandoned Engineering
programme.desc: A formerly luxurious and strategic mountain-top villa on the island of Rhodes in the Mediterranean that's been ravaged by acts of revenge by locals since 1955.

programme.title: Bangers and Cash
programme.desc: Derek collects a Jaguar Mark 2 and explains why they made such poor getaway cars for 1960s bank robbers. A customer considers a Morris Marina as a Christmas present for his wife.

programme.title: Secrets of the Railways
programme.desc: Documentary looking at railroads constructed during history's most turbulent periods, now associated with some of mankind's ugliest deeds. Beginning with the Trans-Pyrenees Railway.

programme.title: Steam Train Britain
programme.desc: Great Central Railway's Scott Manley takes a rainy busman's holiday working as a guard at Bury, while a team of volunteers in Wales try to keep the line clear of overgrown plants.

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature-length episode. Nikki travels to Mexico to attend the funeral of Luisa, a former intern at the Lyell Centre who was murdered in a carjacking in her native country. She soon stumbles across the post-mortem report and realises that the body is not that of her ex-colleague. Assisted by Dr Eva Vasquez and fired up with the idea that Luisa might still be alive, Nikki and Jack trace her last-known movements and are led to a farm where a cartel massacre was carried out. Crime drama, starring Emilia Fox.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The girls receive a surprise visitor who attempts to charm his way into their affections, but Beatrice is highly suspicious. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet and Louise Lombard.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: The sisters are torn between a prestigious job offer in Paris and their fashion house, and Jack creates another dilemma by asking Beatrice to marry him. Period drama, starring Stella Gonet, Aden Gillett, Louise Lombard and Barbara Jefford.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.

programme.title: The House of Eliott
programme.desc: Beatrice's baby is born prematurely, taking everyone by surprise, and Evie longs for the chance to see Daniel again.

programme.title: Soldier, Soldier
programme.desc: B Company are on exercise in the Northern Territory of Australia, and their skills are put to the test during a trip in the outback.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Jim's gambling habit looks like it's about to be exposed when he's spotted at a dog track by Steve and Honey, while Terry arrests his own brother on a trumped-up charge, determined to discover whether he's really abusing his sons. Elsewhere, an act of vandalism at a church leads Tony to a wholly unexpected encounter with another of the Radford boys - has this scion of the notorious crime family really become a man of the cloth?.

programme.title: Holby City
programme.desc: Zubin's jealousy overcomes him as things heat up between Jess and Reza, and after a mistake in surgery he takes his frustration out on his rival. Diane begins to suspect she has made a mistake moving in with Owen, Ric and Will grow closer, much to Connie's annoyance, and Tricia needs reassurance that Carlos loves her, but her anxiety only serves to drive them apart.

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: A youth is beaten up in the back room of a club while attempting to track down his gambling addict mother. An elderly woman suffers an accident involving decorating equipment after wandering from her residential home to her former flat - which is now occupied by someone else.

programme.title: The Bill
programme.desc: Terry is beside himself with worry about his nephews' safety, convinced they are being abused by his brother, and jeopardises the case to help them. Meadows attends the funeral of former colleague Ted Roach, and is drawn into investigating the suspicious circumstances surrounding his death, helped by ex-coppers Bob Cryer and Alec Peters. Questioning his own mortality in the process, he wonders whether a quieter pace of life would suit him better, but soon realises he would miss the thrill of the job and sets off home in a more positive mood - until he gets a shooting pain down his arm.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Emotions run high when a removal van suddenly appears in Albert Square.

programme.title: Classic EastEnders
programme.desc: Sharon demands some explanations from Grant, but then decides to play him at his own game.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: Part one of two. Adaptation of Charles Dickens' story. An orphan boy endures a horrible childhood in the workhouse, but yearns for more. After being sold to a cruel undertaker, he runs away to London - where he joins a group of pickpockets. Timothy Spall heads an all-star cast as Fagin, with support from Tom Hardy, Gregor Fisher, Sarah Lancashire, Sophie Okonedo, Julian Rhind-Tutt and William Miller in the title role.

programme.title: Oliver Twist
programme.desc: Part two of two. Sikes escapes back to London with a badly wounded Oliver, while Mr Bumble declares his love for Mrs Corney - and captivated by the promise of social advancement, she agrees to marry him. Later, Nancy stumbles on a secret meeting, during which she overhears Monks telling Fagin he wants Oliver dead in two days.

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Compo and Clegg are saved from the boredom of a garden fete when they meet a tramp with a peculiar interest in donkeys. Christmas special from 1987.

programme.title: Father Brown
programme.desc: The priest encounters a man who intends to solve his father's murder a year earlier with the use of his brand-new invention - a time machine. Fifties-set crime drama, starring Mark Williams.

programme.title: Death in Paradise
programme.desc: Humphrey and Martha's romantic weekend on a remote island is cut short when a fellow hotel guest is stabbed to death in his room in what appears to be an attempted robbery. But since the flower beds outside the window are undisturbed, Humphrey is certain that one of the victim's associates played a part in his death. There's just one problem - since the DI had a direct view of the only staircase leading up to the room, he is the alibi for all the suspects. Meanwhile, JP worries about his marriage and seeks relationship advice from Dwayne.

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: The team re-examines the murder of a junior doctor strangled in 2010. Interviewing her relatives, who are all doctors, staff at her hospital and a surgeon who had been the young woman's tutor, officers hope to identify a lead that was missed during the original investigation. Depressed at the thought of his daughter Holly leaving home for university, Danny finds himself being cheered by his colleagues as they hire a pedibus for a ride through central London. Tamzin Outhwaite and Nicholas Lyndhurst star.

programme.title: Taggart
programme.desc: First episode of the Glasgow-set crime drama. A murderer is on the loose, and one by one, bodies of young women are found strangled in the city. The inquiry is headed by top detective Jim Taggart, a tough local cop who has risen through the ranks and one of the new breed of graduate policemen, Peter Livingstone. However, despite their differences they work together breaking all the rules to hunt the killer before he strikes again. Mark McManus and Neil Duncan star.

programme.desc: Join Stephen Dixon and Gillian Joseph for all the news from home and abroad, the latest sport and weather, and a review of the weekend papers.

programme.title: New Year's Eve
programme.desc: Join Anna Botting and the Sky News team in London and Edinburgh as we gear up for Big Ben striking midnight to mark the end of 2019.

programme.title: The Holiday (2006)
programme.desc: Two single women living on opposite sides of the Atlantic agree to exchange houses over the Christmas holidays. In their new surroundings, both women unexpectedly encounter prospective partners, but as the house swap draws to a close, difficult decisions have to be made about their blossoming relationships. Romantic comedy, starring Cameron Diaz, Kate Winslet, Jack Black, Jude Law and Eli Wallach.

programme.title: Bang on the Money
programme.desc: Rickie Haywood-Williams and Melvin Odoom host the final edition of the high-precision game show. This time, 'The Arc Angels' from Northampton take on Mr England, Mr Birmingham and Miss Basingstoke, known collectively as 'The Pageant People'. The two teams battle it out to hit a specific target number 'bang on' in a series of physical and mental challenges, and at the end of the contest, the most successful group could win up to 40,000

programme.title: ITV Nightscreen
programme.desc: Text-based information service.

programme.title: Ainsley's Caribbean Kitchen
programme.desc: Ainsley Harriott takes a tour of Tobago, where he puts his own spin on some local recipes, including hand clapped rotis, dougla rum chicken, mustard fish and mango chili chow, and a bluewater breeze cocktail. He also helps Charlottesville fishermen to bring in the day's catch and takes a relaxing boat trip to the Nylon Pool.

programme.title: Good Morning Britain
programme.desc: Morning magazine featuring a lively mix of news and current affairs, plus health, entertainment and lifestyle features.

programme.title: Lorraine
programme.desc: Entertainment, current affairs and fashion news, as well as showbiz stories and celebrity gossip. Presented by Lorraine Kelly.

programme.title: Judge Rinder
programme.desc: Cameras follow criminal barrister Robert Rinder as he takes on real-life cases in a studio courtroom.

programme.title: Midsomer Murders
programme.desc: When a family glassware business collapses following the death of one of its partners, Barnaby investigates allegations of financial irregularities, love triangles and a string of murders. Lapsed Freemason Jones uses his inside knowledge to explore the ceremonial aspects of two killings, but it is Cully's production of Hamlet that gives Tom the key to the mystery. John Nettles, Jason Hughes, Jane Wymark and Laura Howard star.

programme.title: STV News and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: The Queen (2006)
programme.desc: Oscar-winning fact-based drama, examining the events surrounding the death of Princess Diana. The relationship between the monarch and Prime Minister Tony Blair is revealed as they struggle to reach a compromise in dealing with the situation. Starring Helen Mirren in an Oscar-winning role, alongside Michael Sheen, James Cromwell, Helen McCrory and Sylvia Syms.

credits.actor: Helen Mirren in an Oscar-winning role

programme.title: Tenable
programme.desc: Five postal workers from Morecambe show their knowledge of top 10 lists from the realms of pop culture and general knowledge, then try to score a perfect 10 in the final round to take home the prize money. Hosted by Warwick Davis.

programme.title: Tipping Point: Lucky Stars
programme.desc: Ben Shephard invites Alan Davies, Sally Phillips and Dr Ranj Singh to take part in a special edition of the quiz show, in which they must answer questions to win turns on an arcade-style machine. Dropping tokens down a choice of four chutes, they hope to knock piles of them off a moving shelf - and the more they collect, the better their chances of collecting the 20,000 prize for their selected charity.

programme.title: The Chase Celebrity Special
programme.desc: Bradley Walsh presents as celebrity contestants Suzi Perry, Mark Porter, Rosemarie Ford and Louis Walsh pit their wits against ruthless quiz genius the Chaser in the hope of winning a potential prize pot worth thousands of pounds. They must work as a team and play strategically to answer general knowledge questions against the clock and race down the game board to the exit without being caught.

programme.title: In for a Penny
programme.desc: Stephen Mulhern hosts the game show which takes place in public locations around the UK. He invites passers-by in Newcastle to take part in a series of unusual challenges, with a prize of 1,000 up for grabs.

programme.title: STV News at Six and Weather
programme.desc: Including regional weather forecast.

programme.title: Emmerdale
programme.desc: While Victoria goes into labour, most of the locals enjoy New Year celebrations, but Moira is full of self-hatred.

programme.title: Coronation Street
programme.desc: In a bid to get out of taking Tracy to a gig, Steve makes out Tim is ill so he has to go to work, but that plan soon backfires. Abi confides in Eileen that she fancies Kevin, Ray thanks Alya for her help with the New Year's Eve party, and offers her Michelle's old job as Events Manager.

programme.title: Spectre (2015)
programme.desc: James Bond goes rogue after receiving a cryptic message that sets him on the trail of a secretive criminal network. While his colleagues face a new threat closer to home, Bond embarks on a globetrotting journey in search of the elusive mastermind behind the syndicate - whom he discovers may have links to his own past and had involvement in previous events during some of Bond's most dangerous missions. Spy thriller, starring Daniel Craig, Christoph Waltz, Lea Seydoux, Ben Whishaw and Ralph Fiennes.

programme.title: STV News Review
programme.desc: A look back at the news headlines from 2019.

programme.title: Hayman's Way
programme.desc: David Hayman unearths the people and places that make Scotland great. He begins by travelling through stunning Glencoe, uncovers the dark history of the Blackwater Dam and gives ice climbing a go.

programme.title: Sean's Very Scottish Hogmanay
programme.desc: Sean Batty presents a Hogmanay celebration from Craufurdland Castle in Ayrshire, featuring fireworks, ceilidh dancing and Scottish traditions, old and new. Music is provided by singer-songrwriter Dougie MacLean and folk singer Mairi Campbell.

programme.title: Shark Rampage 1916
programme.desc: Recounting the true story of the 1916 shark attack that inspired Oscar-winning blockbuster film Jaws.

programme.title: Shark Attack Survivors
programme.desc: Why the predators attack humans, and advice on the best way to survive in the event of an encounter with the highly evolved killers.

programme.title: Al Murray's Great British Pub Quiz
programme.desc: Al, aided by barman Shaun Williamson and captains Kerry Godliman and Andy Parsons, oversees the clash between Fitzrovia's The Carpenter's Arms and The Craufurd Arms from Berkshire.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: Real-life footage of road-based disasters, including hair-raising near misses, high-octane police chases and disastrous car accidents.

programme.title: Wheels That Fail
programme.desc: A comedic complication of some of the most outrageous and dangerous misadventures on wheels. From faulty designs to stunts gone wrong, the crazy real-life footage is endless.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: A chain reaction of explosions is triggered by a grenade, a aeroplane crashes at a baseball match and a house is lifted off its foundations in a backdraft explosion.

programme.title: Destroyed in Seconds
programme.desc: An F-18 fighter jet crash lands, a car becomes airborne before crashing at 230mph, a skier narrowly survives a 100ft jump and the crew of a cargo ship is rescued.

programme.title: Swamp Loggers
programme.desc: The workers have been struggling with heavy rains, equipment breakdowns and poor access, but hope to finally hit their 100-ton target with the new road now in service.

programme.title: Overhaulin'
programme.desc: The team tries to fulfil a man's dream of restoring his father's old Chevrolet Impala by freshening up its appearance with a complete makeover.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Junk expert Lawrie Voutier and his crew of misfits crash and bash everything from heritage properties to industrial warehouses seeking cash. In the first episode, Lawrie struggles to move a heavy piano from the second storey of his friend's house, while Benny Schaap unearths rare red stained glass in an old Victorian cottage.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Demolition man Lawrie helps clear out his friend Johnny's property, hoping to find treasure amidst the junk. Team-mate Jabba starts a big job demolishing a restaurant.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Lawrie has his sights set on a 90-year-old hardwood staircase in a Brighton mansion, looking to his 12-year-old son Charlie to prove that he too is a demo man.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Lawrie heads to a well-known antique auction house to collect a copper statue. However, he cannot help finding a few other items he would like to add to his collections.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: Jabba is given the task of a full demolition, and in order to get a house down in a day asks Mikaley and Jimmy to lend a hand.

programme.title: Demolition Man
programme.desc: The Demo Man's son Charlie loves hanging out with the big boys and toys, so Lawrie drops him off at a job to help demolish on old farmhouse.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Compton dives into the murky secrets of Second World War spies. In Italy, he unearths an iconic code-breaking machine. In the UK the lads revive two rocket launchers.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton and ex-Para Freddy head to Russia, finding some of Moscow's biggest military dealers. Back home, the twins restore a rare German engine starter.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to a Martello Tower on the Channel Islands. Meanwhile, the twins are tasked to get a Second World War Napalm filled flamethrower ready for a buyer.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton takes Hus on an Italian road-trip. From Venice to Lake Garda, the pair meet up with dealers whose objects tell the story of Italy's role in the Second World War.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton uncovers plans for the D-Day invasion. Plus, he experiences a bumpy landing for a Dakota aeroplane, and in France his passion hits new heights with a parachute jump.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton acquires an extremely rare - and valuable - German Panther tank - and its original undercoat is more pink than camouflage. However, getting parts is a struggle.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: At Biggin Hill, south-east London, military equipment collector Bruce Crompton views a collector's haul of Second World War Spitfires. Plus, the twins prepare some wartime artillery guns to export to Australia - but it's no easy feat.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads to Finland looking for props, including Cold War Russian anti-aircraft guns, for a new blockbuster movie.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Eccentric military equipment collector Bruce Crompton heads on a First World War treasure hunt, finding a mysterious soldier's medal from the Battle of the Somme as well as the world's most expensive football.

programme.title: Combat Dealers
programme.desc: Bruce Crompton buys a rare Sherman tank in Ohio. However, before he sells it on it he wants to boost its authenticity and value, so consultd a tank expert for advice.

programme.title: Explosions Gone Wrong
programme.desc: Experts examine the science behind big blasts and suggest how they can be prevented. Featuring footage of exploding buildings, roads, trains and other vehicles.

programme.title: Salvage Hunters
programme.desc: Drew Pritchard visits an amazing collection of wicker in the Somerset levels and is smitten by an Orkney chair. In Glasgow, he finds an easel that's a work of art.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: Border Control: Spain
programme.desc: The interventions of the Security and Customs Services at the borders of Spain, whose staff are under the constant threat from drugs, weapons, and suspected terrorists.

programme.title: FBI's 10 Most Wanted
programme.desc: The FBI's Most Wanted list has proved one of their most effective weapons in catching criminals. This documentary look at the origin of the famous list, which has included the train robber Tommy Holden, kidnapper Ruth Eisemann, murderer Ted Bundy and terrorist Osama Bin Laden.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: An American woman searches for treatment to deal with a rare medical condition that leaves her constantly aroused.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.desc: After 37-year-old Natasha Cournoyer went missing, police used surveillance video to track her final steps. Eventually, they found her bound, raped, beaten and strangled to death in October 2009.

programme.title: Murder on CCTV
programme.sub-title: The Man in the Red Jacket
programme.desc: On Valentine's night 2015, 27-year-old James Enright was stabbed to death near a station in Burnaby, Canada. Police were heped in their inquiries after discovering the incident had been captured on a phone camera.

programme.title: Forensic Detectives
programme.desc: How cutting-edge technology is being used to solve murder cases more than a decade old, with a look at the kinds of information detectives search for when fresh clues are scarce.

programme.title: FBI Files
programme.desc: One surviving victim of a serial killer gives testimony to support the forensic evidence against her attacker, and brings the murderer to justice.

programme.title: Animal Cops Detroit
programme.desc: The prosecution of an owner of a pair of pit bull terriers suffering from severe mange is considered, while a starving and dehydrated puppy is rescued. Plus, investigators have to break things up when two pit bulls attack each other.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called upon to treat a policeman's poisoned pet, a malnourished penguin that has been washed ashore and a puppy with a damaged leg.

programme.title: Bondi Vet
programme.desc: Dr Chris Brown is called to treat a 12-year-old cat that has been dumped in the surf on Bondi Beach, and tries to help a parrot suffering from depression.

programme.title: Say Yes to the Dress
programme.desc: A bride cannot commit to a dress as her mother is too ill to come and approve it, while another customer desperately wants a gown that is over her budget.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Twenty-year-old Mariah visits Dr Emma about her severe acne. Jonathan has around 40 fatty lumps under his skin, and young mum Holly worries she has two extra nipples.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr Emma helps Abi, who suffers from her excessive sweating. Stephen seeks treatment for a skin disease, which has left him with 200 lumps of fat beneath his skin.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: David visits Dr Emma about a large lump on his back which is growing rapidly. Aria's transition from male to female is blighted by the beard growth on her face.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Sarah's severe rosacea means her face is so red, she's too embarrassed to go out. Dr Emma uses advanced technology to remove a tumour from Tracyleanne's nose.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Dr Emma Craythorne and her team of experts are on a mission to solve complex skin conditions. Louise's skin problem has taken over her life and now she desperately needs help. Plus, the cysts, blackheads and acne on 43-year-old Scott's back is ruining his life.

programme.title: The Bad Skin Clinic
programme.desc: Twenty four-year-old Elise visits Dr Emma Craythorne in a last-ditch attempt to fix her excruciatingly painful skin condition, while Gary wants a lump on the back of his head removed.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: The large bump at the base of Taylor's spine is more dangerous than she realises. John has an embarrassing lump on his hip, and Noelle wants her stretched ears repaired.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Following the work of Dr Sandra Lee, a dermatologist who known for her YouTube channel where she streams videos of procedures.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: The story of Melissa, who covered her huge lipoma with a sweatshirt for years. Tyler's fear of cancer stopped his head lumps being diagnosed, and Tahj is covered in painful boils.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Ronen has a huge but mysterious lump above his knee. Meanwhile, Amber is suffering from a debilitating skin disease that no one understands.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: Anthony's cyst is treated in the area called the Triangle of Death, and Shane wants to get a lump removed off his back.

programme.title: Dr Pimple Popper
programme.desc: It is a busy time for dermatologist Dr Sandra Lee as she treats patients looking to fix their skin issues ahead of the festive season.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.desc: Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner introduce a case in which a young man received letters from his birth mother and longs to know if the words she wrote were filled with truth.

programme.title: Long Lost Family US
programme.sub-title: My Birth Certificate Reads 'Jane Doe' - Part One
programme.desc: Part one of two. Children adopted out as babies search for their birth families, hoping to find or forge connections to their kin. Hosted by Chris Jacobs and Lisa Joyner.

programme.title: My 600lb Life
programme.desc: Brothers Benji and David were raised on fast food and at 700lb, David is unable to work and Benji, now 475lb, fears that he is heading down the same road.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: The story of a woman who has an extraordinary condition in which she unexpectedly cries tears of blood. Plus, other incredible human stories.

programme.title: Body Bizarre
programme.desc: Featuring a Chinese woman battling an ageing condition, three Filipino brothers who can never grow, an all-dwarf soccer team in Brazil, and a teen with only half a body.
